pageContext.claim: “We have been ripped off by China -- an evacuation of wealth like no country has ever seen before given to another country that's rebuilt itself based on a lot of the money they've taken out of the United States.”
pageContext.analysis: Experts say China's rampant economic growth is largely due to its ability to manufacture en masse while paying much lower wages than in the United States. While this growth is widely acknowledged to have come at U.S. manufacturers' expense, other factors such as automation were also in play.
